Package com.lambdaschool.oktafoundation.controllers

Class OpenController

java.lang.Object
com.lambdaschool.oktafoundation.controllers.OpenController
@RestController
public class OpenController
extends java.lang.Object
The class allows access to endpoints that are open to all users regardless of authentication status. Its most important function is to allow a person to create their own username

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • addSelf

      @PostMapping(value="/createnewuser", consumes="application/json", produces="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addSelf​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserMinimum newminuser) throws java.net.URISyntaxException
      This endpoint always anyone to create an account with the default role of USER. That role is hardcoded in this method.
      Parameters:
      httpServletRequest - the request that comes in for creating the new user
      newminuser - A special minimum set of data that is needed to create a new user
      Returns:
      The token access and other relevent data to token access. Status of CREATED. The location header to look up the new user.
      Throws:
      java.net.URISyntaxException - we create some URIs during this method. If anything goes wrong with that creation, an exception is thrown.

    • returnNoFavicon

      @GetMapping("favicon.ico") public void returnNoFavicon()
      Prevents no favicon.ico warning from appearing in the logs. @ApiIgnore tells Swagger to ignore documenting this as an endpoint.
